titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Henry Moore Papers, 1862-1934 and undated RL.00910
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Library staff; machine-readable finding aid created by: Carrie Mills

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Clergyman of the Methodist Episcopal Church, South, in Rockingham, North Carolina. Sermons and other papers, relating to Biblical exegesis and theology, church missions, religious education, divorce, the Republican Party and the McKinley Tariff of 1890, and Theodore Parker.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], William Henry Moore Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The William Henry Moore Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a deposit in 1951 and 1975.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession(s) described in this finding aid: 10-11-51 and 8-9-75.
Materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: William Henry Moore was a clergyman of the Methodist Episcopal Church, South, in Rockingham, North Carolina.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Sermons and other papers, relating to Biblical exegesis and theology, church missions, religious education, divorce, the Republican Party and the McKinley Tariff of 1890, and Theodore Parker.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed material in box 3 contains church service programs.
